refentry.refsect1:
Description
GtkToolItems are widgets that can appear on a toolbar. To create a toolbar item that contain something else than a button, use gtk_tool_item_new(). Use gtk_container_add() to add a child widget to the tool item.
For toolbar items that contain buttons, see the GtkToolButton, GtkToggleToolButton and GtkRadioToolButton classes.
See the GtkToolbar class for a description of the toolbar widget.

refsect2.title: GtkToolItem
refsect2.para: The GtkToolItem struct contains only private data. It should only be accessed through the functions described below.

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_set_homogeneous ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether tool_item is to be allocated the same size as other homogeneous items. The effect is that all homogeneous items will have the same width as the widest of the items.

refsect2.para: Returns whether tool_item is the same size as other homogeneous items. See gtk_tool_item_set_homogeneous().

TRUE if the item is the same size as other homogeneous item.s

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_set_expand ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether tool_item is allocated extra space when there is more room on the toolbar then needed for the items. The effect is that the item gets bigger when the toolbar gets bigger and smaller when the toolbar gets smaller.

listitem.simpara: a :
Whether tool_item is allocated extra space

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_get_expand ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether tool_item is allocated extra space. See gtk_tool_item_set_expand().

listitem.simpara: a :
TRUE if tool_item is allocated extra space.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.para: Sets the GtkTooltips object to be used for tool_item, the text to be displayed as tooltip on the item and the private text to be used. See gtk_tooltips_set_tip().

The GtkTooltips object to be used

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_set_use_drag_window ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether toolitem has a drag window. When TRUE the toolitem can be used as a drag source through gtk_drag_source_set(). When toolitem has a drag window it will intercept all events, even those that would otherwise be sent to a child of toolitem.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolItem
Whether toolitem has a drag window.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_get_use_drag_window ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether toolitem has a drag window. See gtk_tool_item_set_use_drag_window().

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolItem
TRUE if toolitem uses a drag window.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_set_visible_horizontal ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether toolitem is visible when the toolbar is docked horizontally.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolItem
Whether toolitem is visible when in horizontal mode

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_get_visible_horizontal ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the toolitem is visible on toolbars that are docked horizontally.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolItem
TRUE if toolitem is visible on toolbars that are docked horizontally.

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_set_visible_vertical ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether toolitem is visible when the toolbar is docked vertically. Some tool items, such as text entries, are too wide to be useful on a vertically docked toolbar. If visible_vertical is FALSE toolitem will not appear on toolbars that are docked vertically.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolItem
whether toolitem is visible when the toolbar is in vertical mode

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_get_visible_vertical ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether toolitem is visible when the toolbar is docked vertically. See gtk_tool_item_set_visible_vertical().

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolItem
Whether toolitem is visible when the toolbar is docked vertically

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_set_is_important ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether tool_item should be considered important. The GtkToolButton class uses this property to determine whether to show or hide its label when the toolbar style is GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH_HORIZ. The result is that only tool buttons with the "is_important" property set have labels, an effect known as "priority text"

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolItem
whether the tool item should be considered important

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_get_is_important ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether tool_item is considered important. See gtk_tool_item_set_is_important()

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolItem
TRUE if tool_item is considered important.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_get_icon_size ()
refsect2.para: Returns the icon size used for tool_item. Custom subclasses of GtkToolItem should call this function to find out what size icons they should use.

listitem.simpara: a :
a GtkIconSize indicating the icon size used for tool_item

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_get_orientation ()
refsect2.para: Returns the orientation used for tool_item. Custom subclasses of GtkToolItem should call this function to find out what size icons they should use.

listitem.simpara: a :
a GtkOrientation indicating the orientation used for tool_item

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_get_toolbar_style ()
refsect2.para: Returns the toolbar style used for tool_item. Custom subclasses of GtkToolItem should call this function in the handler of the GtkToolItem::toolbar_reconfigured signal to find out in what style the toolbar is displayed and change themselves accordingly

Possibilities are:
GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH, meaning the tool item should show both an icon and a label, stacked vertically GTK_TOOLBAR_ICONS, meaning the toolbar shows only icons GTK_TOOLBAR_TEXT, meaning the tool item should only show text GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH_HORIZ, meaning the tool item should show both an icon and a label, arranged horizontally (however, note the ::has_text_horizontally that makes tool buttons not show labels when the toolbar style is GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH_HORIZ.

listitem.simpara: a :
A GtkToolbarStyle indicating the toolbar style used for tool_item.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_get_relief_style ()
refsect2.para: Returns the relief style of tool_item. See gtk_button_set_relief_style(). Custom subclasses of GtkToolItem should call this function in the handler of the ::toolbar_reconfigured signal to find out the relief style of buttons.

listitem.simpara: a :
a GtkReliefStyle indicating the relief style used for tool_item.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_retrieve_proxy_menu_item ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GtkMenuItem that was last set by gtk_tool_item_set_proxy_menu_item(), ie. the GtkMenuItem that is going to appear in the overflow menu.

listitem.simpara: a :
The GtkMenuItem that is going to appear in the overflow menu for tool_item.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_get_proxy_menu_item ()
refsect2.para: If menu_item_id matches the string passed to gtk_tool_item_set_proxy_menu_item() return the corresponding GtkMenuItem.

Custom subclasses of GtkToolItem should use this function to update their menu item when the GtkToolItem changes. That the menu_item_ids must match ensures that a GtkToolItem will not inadvertently change a menu item that they did not create.

listitem.simpara: a :
a string used to identify the menu item
The GtkMenuItem passed to gtk_tool_item_set_proxy_menu_item(), if the menu_item_ids match.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_set_proxy_menu_item ()
refsect2.para: Sets the GtkMenuItem used in the toolbar overflow menu. The menu_item_id is used to identify the caller of this function and should also be used with gtk_tool_item_get_proxy_menu_item().

listitem.simpara: a :
a string used to identify menu_item
a GtkMenuItem to be used in the overflow menu

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_item_rebuild_menu ()
refsect2.para: Calling this function signals to the toolbar that the overflow menu item for tool_item has changed. If the overflow menu is visible when this function it called, the menu will be rebuilt.
The function must be called when the tool item changes what it will do in response to the "create_menu_proxy" signal.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolItem

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: The :is-important property
refsect2.para: Whether the toolbar item is considered important. When TRUE, toolbar buttons show text in GTK_TOOLBAR_BOTH_HORIZ mode.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The :visible-horizontal property
refsect2.para: Whether the toolbar item is visible when the toolbar is in a horizontal orientation.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The :visible-vertical property
refsect2.para: Whether the toolbar item is visible when the toolbar is in a vertical orientation.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The ::create-menu-proxy signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkToolItem *toolitem, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para:
This signal is emitted when the toolbar needs information from tool_item about whether the item should appear in the toolbar overflow menu. In response the tool item should either
call gtk_tool_item_set_proxy_menu_item() with a NULL pointer and return TRUE to indicate that the item should not appear in the overflow menu
call gtk_tool_item_set_proxy_menu_item() with a new menu item and return TRUE, or
return FALSE to indicate that the signal was not handled by the item. This means that the item will not appear in the overflow menu unless a later handler installs a menu item.

The toolbar may cache the result of this signal. When the tool item changes how it will respond to this signal it must call gtk_tool_item_rebuild_menu() to invalidate the cache and ensure that the toolbar rebuilds its overflow menu.

listitem.simpara: the object the signal was emitted on
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
TRUE if the signal was handled, FALSE if not

refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when the toolitem's tooltip changes. Application developers can use gtk_tool_item_set_tooltip() to set the item's tooltip.

listitem.simpara: the object the signal was emitted on
the GtkTooltips
the tooltip text
the tooltip private text
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
TRUE if the signal was handled, FALSE if not

refsect2.title: The ::toolbar-reconfigured signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkToolItem *toolitem, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para:
This signal is emitted when some property of the toolbar that the item is a child of changes. For custom subclasses of GtkToolItem, the default handler of this signal use the functions
gtk_toolbar_get_orientation() gtk_toolbar_get_style() gtk_toolbar_get_icon_size() gtk_toolbar_get_relief_style()
to find out what the toolbar should look like and change themselves accordingly.

listitem.simpara: the object the signal was emitted on
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

listitem.para: A subclass of GtkToolItem that displays buttons on the toolbar
A subclass of GtkToolItem that separates groups of items on a toolbar
